name: The Earthwork Leviathan: Druid 33 / DwD 6 / Monk 1
author: grizzled_dwarflord

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Just another one of my ill-mannered, ill-conceived, and ill-begotten attempts at building the perfect dragon.  Incidentally, there is no such thing as a perfect dragon, only near-perfect, or close to perfect, or just nigh of perfect, in which we hold our crude design up to the illuminated model we tote around in our heads, then roll it around in our hands as we contemplate, and then say, “Yes, that will do, pig.  That will do.”
 
Make no mistake, this is a dangerous caster druid who specializes in immobilizing his enemies with Grease, Extended Grease, Stoneholds and Storms of Vengeance, and then mopping up his opponents with his Summons, buffed-up Companion, or even himself if there’s knife-work that needs doing.  It is then coupled and lightly folded with Call Lightnings, Flame Strikes, Infernos (food for thought: an extended Inferno will deal 132d6 points of damage over the course of the spell, no save!). 
 
He also acquires Dragon Shape at Level 32, and has taken measures to make the most of his dragon shape by acquiring Improved Critical: Unarmed, Blindfighting, Epic Prowess and Armor Skin, superb AC, Dwarven Stance, Defensive Awareness I and II, and even secures a 3/- Damage Reduction.  He augments this further with all of your typical Druid Buffs, along with Extended Blood Frenzies and Auras of Vitality (66 round durations).
 
But always remember, you’re a dwarven druid first; the Dragon is your wrath.

Player’s Commentary
This was built and playtested in two environments – PGCC and the World of Greyhawk Action Server.  I would love to try other environments but time is never on my side.  Druids are sometimes misrepresented as the weaker of the caster classes, but it is my opinion they are one of the strongest.  True, this combo does not get concealment, or UMD, or knockdown, but he never really needs it.  He already has the best knockdown ability in the game – Grease – and it stacks with other Greases (Greasi?).  He completely controls the battlefield with just 3 spells – Grease, Stonehold, and Storm of Vengeance, all Conjuration spells, and he sports great DCs in this category to make your opponents fail this sooner or later.  Even mighty ancient dragons will fall down and go boom on your Greases.  Don’t be afraid to pepper the battlefield with everything you have.  I have been known to cast 4 or 5 Storms of Vengeance at once, all in the same area.  When I do that, typically there is nothing left but ashes and shadows burned into the stones.
 
You may drop the 33rd druid level for another level of Monk (perhaps to spread out a bit in Epic levels), but I didn’t have any use for it.  You only get Deflect Arrow for your troubles, while that 33rd level of Druid gives you more spell penetration, longer durations on everything, nets you another round on your Grease spells, and a slightly tougher Companion. 
 
Dwarven Defender was woven into this build whose goal was to acquire Defensive Awareness (I and II) to give both your caster and your dragon the ability to not be flanked or get caught flat-footed (that dragon has lots of juicy Dex AC so you want to keep it if you can).  I could have stopped at DwD5, but DwD6 was sitting right there with 3/- DR so why not?
 
The dragon shape is quite formidable in melee, though his breath weapon is only of the ancient variety.  If you want a breath weapon dragon, that will be a different build.
 
Regarding Dragon Shape, it is important to remember that only 3 things will merge when you shift – your Armor, your Helmet, and your Shield.  You’ll want to equip your favorite shield just prior to merging.  Don’t worry, you won’t lose your Monk AC when you shift.  Seek out those 3 items which have the most favorable properties for you while shifted.  Regardless of your AC sources, only the highest enhancement bonus will be used from either your armor or shield. 
 
And if by some strange fate you die while in Dragon Shape, make sure to unequip and re-equip all of your items (the game doesn’t seem to think you have them on when you die in Dragon form).
If you find yourself in a battle where either you have depleted all of your spells, or you aregoing against enemy where they are of no avail, they you make the shift to the dragon color of your choice and lay waste with your 6-8 attacks per round.
 
Other Builds with these classes: there are very few, and most of them are now illegal by either 1.69/EE standards because they only took 14 or 17 Druid to acquire Dragon Shape. 
 
Dragon of the Stone Halls:  Druid17/DwD22/Monk1, this one only achieves 17 Druid levels and majors in DwD for the DR (and also probably not street legal)
 
Dragon Savant Druid14/DwD14/Monk12 (no longer a legal build and is only shown for historical purposes)
 
One simply called Dragon, a strange Druid18/DwD16/Monk6 build. 
 
And there are the Nature’s Wall series, but none of those go for Dragon Shape, so….
 
 AB
